medical_history.chief_complaint: New-onset psychosis with violence in a 37-year-old man with spinocerebellar ataxia type 10.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Psychiatric symptoms began with delusions of being in the presence of his deceased grandfather, which remitted after treatment with risperidone. Three months later, the patient developed visual illusions, hallucinations, profound irritability, and impulsive violence despite medication adherence.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Stable ataxia and well-controlled seizure disorder on carbamazepine and zonisamide.
medical_history.family_history: Brother with identical neurological symptoms; father who developed poorly controlled anger and aggression.
